title: how did a shurima event start without mentioning rek' sai?
body: rek is probably going to be one of the biggest hurdles for azir, probably right after xerath. She is occupying quite a bit of ancient shuriman land after all. did you guys just feel like we have had enough of void after targon? because we didn't get to know any void beings from there, and even if we did rek has a closer connection to shurima than the void in my understanding.

replies.body:
Rek'Sai inhabits Shurima, but is a creature of the Void. They most likely will bundle her long lore with that of other Void denizens, similar to how they did with the Targon lores.

This way they can explore the relationships Rek'Sai has with their fellow Voidborn, and expand on the lore of that faction, rather than limiting themselves to what they can tell about her and Shurima.
It should easy to stop her in a desert, field that Azir becomes the most powerful. Or may be Skarner becomes ally with Azir and Skarner tries to stop her.

skarner will probably have a big problem with rek, good point. his people are underground and rek is down there as well, so if they are near there will be problems.

and also, though azir has real power, void beings are known to be rather annoyingly hard to remove. especially if you don't know entirely what you need to kill to win.
Because he is not aware of what happened in the milenia that he was dead, if I were him, i would suppose that people fixed the void problem after 1000 years.

Makes sense, until you realize how long targon has been wrestling with it and how azir was supposed to be a pretty learned person. its stands to reason that he had heard of targon's problem with it. maybe rek is a new development, but even if she is she wouldn't be the only one of those in the new shuriman story.

hopefully they are just waiting to do that story, but even then I would have preferred to see some rek now, just for completion's sake.
Gonna be surprised when he discovers that there's this giant infestation of them right below his desert :P Along with a pretty sketchy prophet with some ill intentions.
